â
'''Damn Small Linux''' or '''DSL''' is a [[Free software|free]] [[Linux distribution]] for the [[x86 architecture|X86]] family of [[personal computer]]s. It was designed to run [[Graphical user interface|graphical applications]] on older PC [[Computer hardware|hardware]] -- for example, machines with [[Intel 80486|486]]/early [[Pentium]] [[Microprocessor|processors]] and very little [[Random access memory|memory]]. DSL is a '''[[LiveCD]]''' with a size of 50 [[Megabyte|MB]]. What originally started as an experiment to see how much software could fit in 50 MB eventually became a full-fledged [[Linux]] distribution. It can be installed on storage media with small capacities, like [[bootable business card]]s, [[USB flash drive]]s, various [[memory card]]s, and [[Zip drive]]s.
+
'''Damn Small Linux''' or '''DSL''' is a [[Free software|free]] [[Linux distribution]] for the [[x86 architecture|X86]] family of [[personal computer]]s. It was designed to run [[Graphical user interface|graphical applications]] on older PC [[Computer hardware|hardware]] -- for example, machines with [[Intel 80486|486]]/early [[Pentium]] [[Microprocessor|processors]] and very little [[Random access memory|memory]]. DSL is a '''[[Live CD]]''' with a size of 50 [[Megabyte|MB]]. What originally started as an experiment to see how much software could fit in 50 MB eventually became a full-fledged [[Linux]] distribution. It can be installed on storage media with small capacities, like [[bootable business card]]s, [[USB flash drive]]s, various [[memory card]]s, and [[Zip drive]]s.
== History ==
== History ==

â
The standard flavour of DSL is the [[LiveCD]]. There are also other versions available:
+
The standard flavour of DSL is the [[Live CD]]. There are also other versions available:
* 'Frugal' installation: DSL's [[Cloop|'cloop' image]] is installed, as a single file, to a hard disk [[Disk partitioning|partition]]. This is likely more reliable and secure than a traditional hard drive installation, since the cloop image cannot be directly modified; any changes made are only stored in memory and discarded upon rebooting.
* 'Frugal' installation: DSL's [[Cloop|'cloop' image]] is installed, as a single file, to a hard disk [[Disk partitioning|partition]]. This is likely more reliable and secure than a traditional hard drive installation, since the cloop image cannot be directly modified; any changes made are only stored in memory and discarded upon rebooting.
Line 120: Line 120:
One can also [http://damnsmalllinux.org/wiki/index.php/Boot_Floppies boot DSL using a boot-floppy] created from one of the available floppy images ('bootfloppy.img'; 'bootfloppy-grub.img'; 'bootfloppy-usb.img'; or 'pcmciabootfloppy.img') on very old computers, where the [[BIOS]] does not support the [[El Torito (CD-ROM standard)|El Torito Bootable CD Specification]]. The DSL [[Linux kernel|kernel]] is loaded from the floppy disk into RAM, after which the kernel runs DSL from the CD or USB drive.
One can also [http://damnsmalllinux.org/wiki/index.php/Boot_Floppies boot DSL using a boot-floppy] created from one of the available floppy images ('bootfloppy.img'; 'bootfloppy-grub.img'; 'bootfloppy-usb.img'; or 'pcmciabootfloppy.img') on very old computers, where the [[BIOS]] does not support the [[El Torito (CD-ROM standard)|El Torito Bootable CD Specification]]. The DSL [[Linux kernel|kernel]] is loaded from the floppy disk into RAM, after which the kernel runs DSL from the CD or USB drive.
â
DSL was [[Porting|ported]] to the [[Xbox]] [[video game console]] as '''[http://www.x-dsl.org/ X-DSL]'''. X-DSL requires a [[Xbox#Xbox modding|modified]] Xbox. It can run as a LiveCD or be installed to the Xbox hard drive. Users have also run X-DSL from a USB flash drive, using the USB adaptor included with [[Phantasy Star Online]], which plugs into the memory card slot and includes one USB 1.1 port. X-DSL boots into a [[X Window System|X11]]-based GUI; the Xbox [[Game controller|controller]] can be used to control the mouse pointer and enter text using a [[virtual keyboard]]. X-DSL has a [[Fluxbox]] desktop, with programs for E-mail, web browsing, word processing and playing music. X-DSL can be customized by downloading extensions from the same MyDSL servers as DSL.
+
DSL was [[Porting|ported]] to the [[Xbox]] [[video game console]] as '''[http://www.x-dsl.org/ X-DSL]'''. X-DSL requires a [[Xbox#Xbox modding|modified]] Xbox. It can run as a Live CD or be installed to the Xbox hard drive. Users have also run X-DSL from a USB flash drive, using the USB adaptor included with [[Phantasy Star Online]], which plugs into the memory card slot and includes one USB 1.1 port. X-DSL boots into a [[X Window System|X11]]-based GUI; the Xbox [[Game controller|controller]] can be used to control the mouse pointer and enter text using a [[virtual keyboard]]. X-DSL has a [[Fluxbox]] desktop, with programs for E-mail, web browsing, word processing and playing music. X-DSL can be customized by downloading extensions from the same MyDSL servers as DSL.
